t: Amazon Trade-In: Get Paid for Your Used Items
s: Introducing Amazon Trade-in Rebates. Upgrade to your new device at the full advertised price, and keep using your current one until the replacement arrives. Once you have the new device, simply send back the old one, and get a partial refund for the value of your old device.

t: Brand name
s: Amazon created what they called Brand Registry, which in simple terms means anyone can buy generic items, and call them by their own made-up brand name. It has even happened to well known brands of items where they are being sold under a made-up brand name. In my opinion it was not Amazon's ...

t: Amazon Brand Registry | Sell on Amazon
s: To enroll your brand in Amazon Brand Registry and start unlocking exclusive benefits, you need to meet two basic requirements: Brand name and logo: Have a logo that includes your brand name permanently affixed to your products or packaging. Trademark: Have a pending or registered trademark ...

t: List of Amazon brands - Wikipedia
s: November 26, 2024 - Some of Amazon's store brands require an Amazon Prime membership to purchase. In August 2005, Amazon began selling products under its own private label, Pinzon. The trademark applications indicated that the label would be used for textiles, kitchen utensils, and other household goods.

t: Create a Trade-In - Amazon Customer Service
s: Create a Trade-In order to exchange Amazon Devices and other eligible electronics, video games, cell phones, and more. Eligible Trade-In orders receive an Amazon.com Gift Card and limited-time promotional discount towards the purchase of a qualifying Amazon Device.
